page.title: 03 St Minver Parish Church
page.content: The parish church of St.Minver, with its{spire, }which is quite a rarity in Cornwall, was built in the 12 to 1300s. Much of the building was pulled down and rebuilt in the late 1800s.There remain several Norman octagonal pillars at the north side,and a font at the rear,of the same period.The three oldest of the six bells were cast in 1777.{Sunday {services}are the busiest especially at eleven am. The vast majority of the St.Minver parish population lives to the West of the block where there are two daughter churches, but many of them attend this church.The church hall, at the village crossroads, is called the{Perceval Institute.}A Sunday School is held every Sunday in the Vicarage which is about 100m to the east of the church.
